name: Peregrine falcon
description: Flight-diving The peregrine falcon is the fastest aerial animal, fastest animal in flight, fastest bird, and the overall fastest member of the animal kingdom. The peregrine achieves its highest velocity not in horizontal level flight, but during its characteristic hunting stoop. While stooping, the peregrine falcon soars to a great height, then dives steeply at speeds of over 200 mph (320 km/h).

name: Eurasian hobby
description: Flight  Can sometimes outfly the swift

name: Mexican free-tailed bat
description: Flight  It has been claimed to have the fastest horizontal speed (as opposed to stoop diving speed) of any animal.

name: Frigatebird
description: Flight  The frigatebird's high speed is helped by its having the largest wing-area-to-body-weight ratio of any bird.

name: Rock dove (pigeon)
description: Flight: Pigeons have been clocked flying 92.5 mph (148.9 km/h) average speed on a 400-mile (640 km) race.

name: Black marlin
description: Swimming: A hooked black marlin has been recorded stripping line off a fishing reel at 120 feet per second (82 mph; 132 km/h).

name: Cheetah
description: Land  Fastest land-animal, fastest feline, the cheetah can accelerate from 0 to 96.6 km/h (60.0 mph) in under three seconds, though endurance is limited.
